SEARCH
Package wtf.file.api.data

Schnittstelle Pixel

Alle bekannten Unterschnittstellen:
EditablePixel
public interface Pixel
Represents a single pixel in an image, defined by a ColorSpace and a mapping of ColorChannel values.

A pixel provides access to its channel values, can be queried for individual channels, and can be converted to another ColorSpace representation.

  • Methodenübersicht

    Modifizierer und Typ
    Methode
    Beschreibung
    Pixel
    as(ColorSpace colorSpace)
    Converts this pixel to the given ColorSpace, potentially performing a transformation or mapping between channel sets.
    ColorSpace
    colorSpace()
    Gets the ColorSpace that defines the color composition of this pixel.
    short
    valueOf(ColorChannel channel)
    Retrieves the numeric value associated with a specific color channel.
    Map<ColorChannel,Short>
    values()
    Returns the mapping of ColorChannel to their corresponding numeric values for this pixel.

  • Methodendetails

    • colorSpace

      ColorSpace colorSpace()
      Gets the ColorSpace that defines the color composition of this pixel.
      Gibt zurück:
      the ColorSpace of the pixel.

    • values

      Map<ColorChannel,Short> values()
      Returns the mapping of ColorChannel to their corresponding numeric values for this pixel.
      Gibt zurück:
      a map of ColorChannel to short values.

    • valueOf

      short valueOf(ColorChannel channel)
      Retrieves the numeric value associated with a specific color channel.
      Parameter:
      channel - the ColorChannel to query.
      Gibt zurück:
      the value of the specified channel.
      Löst aus:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the channel is not part of this pixel's ColorSpace.

    • as

      Pixel as(ColorSpace colorSpace)
      Converts this pixel to the given ColorSpace, potentially performing a transformation or mapping between channel sets.
      Parameter:
      colorSpace - the target ColorSpace.
      Gibt zurück:
      a new Pixel in the specified color space, or null if it could not be converted.
